alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 9:44PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A BAND OF SNOW WILL AFFECT CENTRAL ALLEGANY COUNTY IN WESTERN MARYLAND...NORTHEASTERN FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA... SOUTHWESTERN MORGAN COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA... NORTHEASTERN MINERAL AND NORTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHEASTERN CITY OF WINCHESTER... At 938 PM EST, a narrow band of snow was located from near Cumberland to north of Winchester. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. Locations impacted include... Winchester, Cumberland, Paw Paw, La Vale, Ridgeley, Cresaptown, Potomac Park, Wiley Ford, Ellerslie, Corriganville, Green Spring, Oldtown, Spring Gap, Cedar Grove, Clear Brook, Pumpkin Center, North Branch, Bloomery, Stephenson, and Wolfe Mill. This includes Interstate 68 in Maryland between mile markers 40 and 52 and Interstate 81 in Virginia between mile markers 315 and 323. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile and up to one inch of snow may accumulate, especially in the Cumberland area. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
